comment: This professor is not a teacher. You have to actually teach to be a teacher, which he does absolutely zilch of. I'm serious, do NOT take this professor, especially not online. He does not work with students, or answer questions. He is horrific.

I actually took his Chem 1151 class online at Georgia Perimeter College. He literally did not teach us one thing. We had to use the mastering chemistry site and textbook to teach ourselves. Unfortunately, he does not use these sources when making tests. Also, he will not give any guidelines for studying for the final.

He is a fair teacher and corrects mistakes on quizzes and test. Corrections usually benefit the student.  Tests are not too difficult and mostly multiple choice. Do not take notes!! He is not the best teacher but does know the subject. Just read i-college lecture notes. Study on your own and work as many problems as one can find!
Very difficult to understand accent. Not helpful when questions are asked. Does not give clear explanations.

You do not have to go to class because you end up teachng everything to yourself.  He can't speak english too well and attendance isnt mandatory. Quizzes are online, there are 3 tests and one final.  ALLLL are OPEN BOOK. But its not that easy, most of the questions are kinda tricky and they stil require knowledge of the subjectt

I recommed this teacher. He does have a strong accent which is a little hard to understand but uses powerpoint. post all his notes on webct and dosnt penalize for absences.He gives practice quizes befor every test. The test often has questions that are word for word from the practive quiz. give bonus pts. good professor, very smart highly recommend

I thought he was a horrible teacher.  You cannot understand a WORD that he says and so it is difficult to learn anything. The quizzes and exams are not THAT hard, but it is not worth it. I do not recommend this class for anyone who does not know how to teach themselves.

He's easy as far as he gives you half the answers for all the quizzes and half the answers for the tests...but extremely hard to understand. He also has trouble understanding his students. When you ask for help, he refers you to tutoring. I learned more in lab than I did in his class.
